thread.title: Bath clinches share of LCAA title
thread.title_full: Bath clinches share of LCAA title

author: The Leader staff
title: Bath clinches share of LCAA title
text: Bath clinches share of LCAA title Comment Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 9:34 PM Updated at 9:35 PM Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 9:34 PM Updated at 9:35 PM BATH | Ignited by two goals from Andres Warren Wednesday, the Bath Haverling Rams posted a 4-0 shutout of Dansville and secured at least a share of the Livingston County Athletic Association Division I title. On Friday, Bath can win an LCAA Division I title outright with either a win or tie against rival Hornell. The Rams got one goal and one assist from Connor Strong. Elliott Hillman also netted a goal for Bath and teammate Casey Hyer added with two assists. Warren opened the scoring by connecting on a 35-yard blast with 26:32 remaining in the opening half. Warren’s shot caught the bottom of the crossbar and ricocheted into the right corner of the goal. Twelve minutes later, Bath’s lead grew to 2-0 when Strong headed in a free kick from Hyer. The Rams took a 2-0 lead into intermission. Bath’s Steven Binkowski made four saves in goal to record the shutout. “It was a good game,” Bath head coach Matt Hill said. “I was pleased that we were able to score four goals. It’s a nice accomplishment against a team like Dansville.” Bath (10-4-1) will play at Hornell at 6:30 p.m. Friday. The Rams will look to clinch their first LCAA title since 2011. Bath only has one loss in the division, while Hornell and Livonia each have two division losses. By The Leader staff
